page.title: 06Colwall Race Course
page.content: Before the second World War there were many more race-courses in Britain than there are today, and one of them was in Colwall. Racegoers used to arrive in the village by train before the advent of the motor car, and special trains were laid on to bring them. The name of the public house called The Horse and Jockey is one of the few remaining reminders of the old race-course, because after the war, racing in Colwall, as in many other places, was never resumed. For many years the course was overgrown with brambles, but with rising prices for farm products it was recently cleared, ploughed, and returned to farmland. Old photographs of Colwall race days are still to be seen in The Park Hotel, in the heart of the village. The nearest racecourse now is at Worcester.
